title: Omnitracs Releases Video Explaining Benefits Of Adopting ELDs In Lieu Of Paper Logs
text:
Omnitracs, LLC
Beyond Compliance, Adoption of ELDs Saves Fleets Time and Money, Improves Efficiency
DALLAS , Aug. 25, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Omnitracs, LLC , a leading provider of fleet management solutions to transportation and logistics companies, today released a new video detailing the significant benefits to fleets of adopting Electronic Logging Devices (ELDs). In addition to ensuring compliance with the pending ELD mandate, fleets that adopt electronic logs realize benefits including cost reduction, time savings, and efficiency improvements. The new video is live on www.ELDfacts.com , an important online resource established to help carriers better understand and prepare for this regulation, and provides valuable information on the many operational advantages delivered by ELDs.
"While many fleets today are looking to ELDs simply as a requirement for compliance with the pending FMCSA mandate, it's critically important that companies are also aware of the many additional ways this technology can improve their business," stated Tom Cuthbertson , vice president of regulatory compliance at Omnitracs. "Both drivers and back-office staff experience time savings, simplification of their work, and increased accuracy of records, all of which can result in cost reductions and improved productivity for the fleet."
The visually compelling video utilizes whiteboard drawings to illustrate key messages in an easy-to-understand format. Among the ELD benefits-beyond compliance with the FMCSA mandate-noted in the video are:
Cost reduction -fleets no longer need to purchase and store paper logs, fines for violations are reduced, and lost revenue due to out-of-service orders is eliminated Time savings -drivers spend less time maintaining manual records and more time driving, back-office staff spend less time reviewing logs and correcting errors, and managers no longer have to invest significant time keeping up with the nuances of evolving Hours of Service rules Efficiency improvements -fleets report gaining 15 minutes of additional driving time per day as a result of adopting electronic logs; record-keeping errors are eliminated, and drivers and back-office staff can invest more time on revenue-generating tasks The video is second in the creative whiteboard series produced by Omnitracs, and is one of many resources it has developed designed to inform customers and the industry at large of regulatory developments related to ELDs. To watch the new video and access additional educational assets, please visit www.ELDfacts.com .
About Omnitracs, LLC
Omnitracs, LLC is a global pioneer of fleet management, routing and predictive analytics solutions for private and for-hire fleets. Omnitracs' more than 800 employees deliver software-as-a-service-based solutions to help more than 30,000 private and for-hire fleet customers manage nearly 1,000,000 mobile assets in more than 60 countries. The company pioneered the use of commercial vehicle telematics over 25 years ago and today its intuitive technologies, including solutions for safety and compliance, fuel efficiency, driver retention, fleet productivity, GPS fleet tracking, route planning, scheduling, and fleet maintenance, enable customers to solve common fleet problems and achieve their business objectives. Omnitracs, LLC includes Roadnet Technologies, XRS, Sylectus, Omnitracs Analytics, and Omnitracs Mexico. Omnitracs is part of the Vista Equity Partners portfolio of companies.
